p: Whilst not yet supported by evidence of OS improvement, dual CTLA-4/PD-1 blockade might also be beneficial, given the different and alternative role of the two biologic axes within the cancer immunity cycle, as CTLA-4 is a key driver in downregulation of tumour-antigen presenting cells and in T-regs enhancement, whereas PD-1/PD-L1 mainly impairs the efficiency of the CD8 + CTL response. Reliable evidence of synergistic effects from CTLA-4/PD-1 co-inhibition has been observed in clinical trials amongst other tumour types, in melanoma [ 8], renal cell carcinoma [ 9] and NSCLC [ 10].
